beginning.s: CARS 2 WRITTEN BY BEN QUEEN A sleek British sports car talks directly to us in a pixilated, garbled video.
He's OUT OF BREATH.
Crates are visible behind him.
We're in the shadowy bowels of a steel room.
LELAND TURBO This is Agent Leland Turbo.
I have a flash transmission for Agent Finn McMissile.
SUPERIMPOSE OVER BLACK: WALT DISNEY PICTURES PRESENTS LELAND TURBO Finn.
My cover's been compromised.
Everything's gone pear-shaped.
SUPERIMPOSE OVER BLACK: A PIXAR ANIMATION STUDIOS FILM LELAND TURBO You won't believe what I've found out here.
He angles our camera view, reveals a PORTHOLE through which we can see flames rising in the distance.
LELAND TURBO This is bigger than anything we've ever seen.
And no one even knows it exists.
Finn, I need backup.
But don't call the cavalry - it could blow the operation.
And be careful.
It's not safe out here!
ANGRY VOICES O.S.
Time for Turbo to go.
LELAND TURBO Transmitting my grids now.
Good luck!
Coordinates appear: 40 6.80' N - 172 23.84' W TITLE CARD: CARS 2

scene.sceneheader: EXT. SOMEWHERE IN THE NORTH PACIFIC - NIGHT

meta.s: A TINY CRAB BOAT (CRABBY) crests over massive swells.

dialogue.name: CRABBY
dialogue.s: Right where you paid me to bring you.

meta.s: A metallic blue sports car, circa the `60s, emerges from the 2. shadows.
Cagey, smooth, he'd turn heads driving through any intersection in the world.
Meet FINN MCMISSILE.

dialogue.name: CRABBY
dialogue.s: Hey pal, you can't get any further away from land than out here.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Exactly where I want to be.

dialogue.name: CRABBY
dialogue.s: Well I got news for you, buddy.
There's nobody out here but us.

meta.s: Suddenly, a HORN -- a COMBAT SHIP, the size of most cruise ships.
FINN quickly backs into the shadows, out of sight.

dialogue.name: COMBAT SHIP
dialogue.s: What are you doing out here?

dialogue.name: CRABBY
dialogue.s: What does it look like, genius?

dialogue.name: COMBAT SHIP
dialogue.s: Well turn around and go back where you came from.

meta.s: A laser sight hits Crabby between the eyes.

dialogue.name: CRABBY
dialogue.s: Don't get your prop in a twist.
(as he turns to leave) What a jerk.
Looks like it's the end of the line.

meta.s: ON CRABBY'S DECK: Finn is gone.
FINN - He HANGS off the side of COMBAT SHIP, clandestine.
We're with Finn as the ship continues on, cuts through the darkness with purpose.
Suddenly small flames appear, perhaps a knot or so away.
Then WHOOSH!!!
A flame rises above Finn, the ship.
It illuminates an OIL DERRICK.
THWAP!
Finn fires a GRAPPLING HOOK to the derrick and SWINGS toward it.
He's going to SLAM into the side with brute force

dialogue.name: WHEN ---
dialogue.s: --- HIS TIRES sprout a magnetic exoskeleton.
He STICKS to the derrick and now DRIVES VERTICALLY UP UP UP...

meta.s: From this vantage point, hundreds of derricks appear.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. PLATFORM - OIL DERRICK - MOMENTS LATER

meta.s: Finn approaches a loading bay from above, hides.
He watches as GREMLINS, PACERS and assorted other cars scurry about.

dialogue.name: FINN (INTO RADIO)
dialogue.s: Leland Turbo, this is Finn McMissile.

meta.s: No response.
AN ACCESS DOOR OPENS LOUDLY below.
A boxy, monacle-wearing German car enters.
This is PROFESSOR OTTO ZUNDAPP.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: (in German and English) Too many cars here.

meta.s: Zundapp approaches a NOSY PACER who idles next to a CRATE.

dialogue.name: NOSY PACER
dialogue.s: You wanted to see this before we load it?

meta.s: A forklift opens the crate -- inside is a TV CAMERA, packed carefully in foam.
Finn SNAPS PHOTOS FURIOUSLY.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: (TO HIMSELF) What are you up to now, Professor?

meta.s: Finn, angling for a better view, FIRES SUSPENSION WIRES --- --- which sail clear to the other side of the derrick --- --- THOK!
They hook tightly onto a steel girder.
Finn slides out ONTO THE WIRE like an acrobat, then expels another cross-wire for support.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: Make sure it is properly secured for the voyage.

meta.s: Finn LOWERS HIMSELF.
He snaps more pictures.
Zundapp turns as a CRANE LOWERS A CAR-SIZED CRATE.
GREM and ACER, an orange Gremlin and a green Pacer, flank it.

dialogue.name: GREM
dialogue.s: This is one of those British spies we told you about.

dialogue.name: ACER
dialogue.s: This one we caught sticking his bumper where it didn't belong.

meta.s: Finn PRODUCES SEMI-AUTOMATIC GUNS from his side, readies himself for a tag-team spy fight with his buddy Leland.
The crate is lifted, revealing a CRUSHED, CUBED Leland Turbo.
Finn's eyes go wide.
Suddenly --- WHOOOSHHH!
Another derrick flame rises behind him, casts a Finn-shaped SHADOW over the Professor.
He looks up.
Finn UNLOADS with bullets as he starts to retreat --- He

dialogue.name: STOPS:
dialogue.s: BAD GUY CARS are waiting for him on the catwalk where he just came from - BLOWTORCHES ready.

meta.s: Finn, stuck in midair, notices an angry CRANE.
Finn GRINS, having just found his escape.
THWAPTHWAPTHWAP!!!
Finn releases three of his four cables, swinging, Indiana Jones-style on the last one TOWARD THE

dialogue.name: CRANE ---
dialogue.s: --- where he lands on its BOOM, drives UP and LAUNCHES OFF IT where he LANDS - MOVING - onto another deck!

meta.s: Finn now DRIVES, spraying oil and screeching around corners.
A GREMLIN in pursuit hits the oil patch, loses control --- --- and PLUMMETS OFF the side of the rig!
The Gremlin FALLS... it's like an eternity...
He smashes into the water and breaks into a million pieces.
ON FINN - Now set upon by 20 or 30 MORE pursuing cars.
He has nowhere to go but UP UP UP a ramp toward the helipad.
He spies some GASOLINE BARRELS, fires a SINGLE BULLET which cuts through its leather straps, sending barrels DOWN the ramp,
--- to the bottom where they EXPLODE in a CHAIN REACTION back UP THE RAMP, taking out at least 15 CARS!
ON THE HELIPAD - Finn blasts into view, pulls to a stop.
No more road.
Nowhere else to go.
The 20 BAD GUY CARS that are still in pursuit surround him, fire up their blowtorches.
About to pounce.
Finn GRINS.
The second time we've seen this grin.
It means he's got something cooking.
Finn's REVERSE LIGHTS appear.
He DRIVES BACKWARD off the edge of the helipad to the SHOCK of the other cars.
Finn falls.
He turns himself so he's grill first, cleanly cutting into the water.
He EMERGES, now sprouting HYDROFOIL and speeds away.
THE BOATS - an army of combat ships quickly DROP into the sea and CHURN WATER with unprecedented fury as they quickly make up the distance between them and Finn, FIRING BULLETS as they do so.
The LEAD COMBAT SHIP quietly drops a TORPEDO into the water.
It skips along, connecting with Finn in his rear and EXPLODING with such force that water skyrockets into the night clouds.
UNDERWATER - McMissile SINKS.
Then, he blinks.
He GRINS.
We're starting to like this grin and what follows it.
He now CONVERTS into a submarine.
From his trunk he releases four DECOY tires which float to the surface like body parts.
ON THE DERRICK - Professor Zundapp watches it all from far away.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: With Finn McMissile gone, who can stop us now?

meta.s: TOW MATER, a rusty tow truck, putters into view.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Tow Mater, that's who... is here to help you!

meta.s: He approaches a broken-down sedan on the side of the road.
He drives around to the front, catching OTIS' face for the first time.

dialogue.name: OTIS
dialogue.s: I thought I could make it this time, but... (he tries to start his engine, stalls) Smooth like pudding, huh?

meta.s: Mater hooks his friend and starts towing him.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well dadgum, you're leaking oil again.
Hey, look on the bright side: This is your tenth tow this month, so that means it's on the house.

dialogue.name: OTIS
dialogue.s: You're the only one that's nice to lemons like me, Mater.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: These things happen to everybody, Otis.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Don't tell nobody, but I think my rust is starting to show through.

meta.s: Mater and Otis drive past THE RADIATOR SPRINGS WELCOME SIGN.
It has been amended to say: "Home of Lightning McQueen."

dialogue.name: OTIS
dialogue.s: Hey, is Lightning McQueen back yet?

dialogue.name: OTIS
dialogue.s: He must be crazy-excited about winning his fourth Piston Cup.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Yeah, we're so dadgum proud of him.
But I sure wish he'd hurry up and get back `cause we got a whole summer's worth of best friend fun to make up for.

meta.s: Ahead of them, a half-mile off, a RED RACE CAR is visible.
Mater FLOORS IT, dragging poor Otis behind him.

dialogue.name: OTIS
dialogue.s: You don't need to go so fast!

meta.s: Boom!
They hit a bump.
Otis catches air.
Lightning McQueen is surrounded by his hometown friends.

dialogue.name: FLO
dialogue.s: Good to have you back, honey.

dialogue.name: SHERIFF
dialogue.s: The place wasn't the same without you, son.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: It's good to be home, everybody.

meta.s: They all turn around, see Mater speeding into town, with Otis swerving behind him.
Mater skids into main street and in one swift motion, slingshots Otis forward ---
--- right through Ramone's front door ---
--- where he lands perfectly on the hydraulic lift.
Ramone lifts him up, routine.

dialogue.name: RAMONE
dialogue.s: How far'd you make it this time, Otis?

dialogue.name: OTIS
dialogue.s: I know, I can't believe it either!

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Mater, it's so good to see you.

meta.s: Mater and McQueen do an ELABORATE TIRE BUMP (fist bump style).

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You ain't gonna believe the things I got planned for us.

meta.s: Everyone watches as the tire bump continues.

dialogue.name: MACK
dialogue.s: (to Lizzie, an aside) These best friend greetings get longer every year.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (TO MCQUEEN) You ready to have some serious fun?

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Well, actually I've got something to show you first.

meta.s: CLOSE ON THE PISTON CUP.
It has now changed, been adorned with a small likeness of Doc.
It says "Hudson Hornet Piston Cup."

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I can't believe they renamed the Piston Cup after our very own Doc Hudson.

meta.s: McQueen and Mater are alone, the museum closed to the public.
McQueen approaches a "Hudson Hornet" wall with Doc's three Piston cups, framed articles, other racing ephemera.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I know Doc said these things were just old cups, but to have someone else win it just didn't feel right, you know?

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well, Doc would've been real proud of you.

meta.s: McQueen takes this in.
McQueen and Mater exit the Doc Hudson Museum.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I've been waiting all summer for this.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You sure you can handle it?

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Come on, you know who you're talking to?

meta.s: Mater and McQueen roll on an old train track, their tires off.
They're on their rims.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Just remember, your brakes ain't gonna work on these!

meta.s: As they head INTO A DARK TUNNEL ---

dialogue.name: MATER (O.S.)
dialogue.s: Relax, these train tracks ain't been used in years!

meta.s: From inside the tunnel a loud TRAIN HORN.
The two friends emerge, going as fast as they can on train tracks, uphill, with no tires.
Moments later a harmless GALLOPING GOOSE appears, oversized horn visible, cackling and laughing at his prank.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. FIELD - OUTSIDE RADIATOR SPRINGS - LATER

meta.s: An ENORMOUS EARTH MOVER sleeps.
McQueen and Mater sneak up.
They blow their horns and he TIPS OVER, tractor-tipping style.
They LAUGH at the gag, but soon realize the earth mover's GIANT EXHAUST PIPE is directly above them.
The exhaust pipe BELCHES.
McQueen and Mater are BLASTED out of view.
The sun sets.
McQueen and Mater roll into town.
McQueen looks exhausted.
Mater is still full of energy.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Boy, this was the best day ever!

meta.s: Mater proudly shows off a dent.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Wait til you see what I got planned for tonight.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I was kind of thinking of just a quiet dinner.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: That's exactly what I was thinking.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You, me and Miss Sally going out for supper.

meta.s: McQueen pulls around in front of Mater, stops.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Mater, I meant it would be just me and Sally.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: We'll do whatever you want tomorrow.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Y'all go on and have fun now.

meta.s: McQueen drives off.
Mater watches him go.
It's been converted into a white-tablecloth restaurant, with cars dining al fresco and a hopping gastropub inside.
MCQUEEN AND SALLY have a prime table with a view of Radiator Springs and the starry night sky.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I can't tell you how good it is to be here alone.

meta.s: Mater is at their table, dressed as a waiter.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: My name is Mater and I'll be your waiter.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: What'd you think, I just snuck in here when nobody was looking and pretended to be your waiter, just so I could hang out with you?

meta.s: McQueen and Sally exchange a look.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Now, can I start you two lovebirds off with a couple drinks?

dialogue.name: SALLY
dialogue.s: I'm going to have that too.

meta.s: Mater blinks.
INSIDE AT THE BAR - Fillmore and Sarge watch as Guido mixes drinks, ala "Cocktail."
Mater arrives.

dialogue.name: GUIDO
dialogue.s: (in Italian, subtitled) How should I know?

meta.s: ON THE BAR TV - "THE MEL DORADO SHOW," a cable talk show, begins with file footage of MILES AXLEROD, a sleek SUV.

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Oil billionaire Miles Axlerod, in an attempt to become the first car to circumnavigate the globe without GPS, ironically ran out of gas and found himself trapped in the wild!

meta.s: We see images of newspaper headlines, search crews.

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Feared dead, he emerged 36 days later, running on a fuel he'd distilled himself from the natural elements!
Since then he's sold his oil fortune, converted himself from a gas-guzzler into an electric car, and has devoted his life to finding a renewable, clean-burning fuel!

meta.s: Images of oil derricks torn down; Miles Axlerod getting converted to electric; lab scientists testing chemicals.

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Now he claims to have done it with his Allinol.

meta.s: Images of fields, rivers, vegetables, and mountains all combining to form the Allinol logo.

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: And to show the world what his new superfuel can do, he's created a racing competition like no other, inviting the greatest champions from around the globe to battle in the first ever World Grand Prix.

meta.s: SIR MILES AXLEROD arrives, parks across from Mel's desk.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD (ON TV)
dialogue.s: It is very good to be here.
Now listen to me: Big Oil.
And we all know what happened to them.
Trust me, Mel, after seeing Allinol in action at the World Grand Prix, nobody will ever go back to gasoline again.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (TO FILLMORE) What happened to the dinosaurs, now?

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: And on satellite, a World Grand Prix competitor and one of the fastest cars in the world, Francesco Bernoulli.

meta.s: Across the screen: LIVE FROM ROME, ITALY.
We meet Formula race car FRANCESCO BERNOULLI.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: It is an honor, Signore Dorado.

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Miles, why not invite Lightning McQueen?

meta.s: Mater, collecting his drinks, looks up, half-intrigued.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD (ON TV)
dialogue.s: But apparently after a very long racing season he is taking some time off to rest.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Lightning McQueen would not have a chance against Francesco!

meta.s: Mater doesn't like this.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: I can go over 300 kilometers an hour!
In miles that is like, uh... way faster than McQueen.

dialogue.name: MEL DORADO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Baltimore, Maryland, you're on the air.

meta.s: Dial tone.

dialogue.name: MATER'S VOICE (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Yeah, that Italian feller you got on there can't talk that way about Lightning McQueen.
He's the bestest race car in the whole wide world.

meta.s: Fillmore and Sarge look around.
Mater is visible in the back of the bar on an office phone.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: If he is, how you say "the bestest race car," then why must he rest, eh?

dialogue.name: MATER'S VOICE (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Every now and then he prefers just to slow down, enjoy life.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Lightning McQueen prefers to be slow!
Of course, this is not news to Francesco.
When I want to go to sleep I watch one of his races.
After two laps I am out cold.

meta.s: Audible RXNS from the bar.
A crowd has been forming ever since Mater started talking.
MCQUEEN AND SALLY - They hear the commotion inside.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Hey, what's going on over there?

dialogue.name: CUT BACK TO:
dialogue.s: THE BAR - Sally and McQueen push through the crowd, see that they're watching Francesco on the television.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: (TO SALLY) Oh, it's that Italian Formula car.

meta.s: When Sally says his name, she enunciates each part, as if Italian were her mother's tongue.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Wait, why do you know his name?
And don't say it like that.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I thought you like my fenders.

dialogue.name: MATER'S VOICE (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Well let me tell you something else there, Mr. San Francisco ---

dialogue.name: MATER'S VOICE (ON TV)
dialogue.s: McQueen could drive circles around you.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Driving in circles is all he can do, no?

dialogue.name: MATER'S VOICE (ON TV)
dialogue.s: I mean he could beat you anywhere, anytime, any track.

meta.s: On McQueen - he looks at Guido who gives a nod over to --- --- Mater, turned away from the crowd, still on the phone.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Francesco needs a caller who can provide a little more intellectual stimulation.

meta.s: ON MCQUEEN.
He doesn't like this at all.
Suddenly, Mater is YANKED from the booth and replaced by McQueen.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN (INTO PHONE)
dialogue.s: Yeah, hi, this is Lightning McQueen.
Look, I don't appreciate my best friend being insulted like that.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO (ON TV)
dialogue.s: This is the difference between you and Francesco.
Francesco knows how good he is.
He does not need to surround himself with tow trucks to prove it.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Those are strong words from a car that is so fragile.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: What is that, your new motto?

meta.s: Francesco goes ballistic in Italian.
They cut his mic.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD (ON TV)
dialogue.s: Well, this sounds like something that needs to be settled on the race course.
What do you say, Lightning McQueen?
We've still got room for one more racer.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: The only thing is my crew's off for the season so ---

meta.s: A sound O.S.
McQueen turns to see Fillmore, Sarge and Luigi flank a tablecloth which is hanging off the bar.
Ramone backs away, having spray painted "TEAM LIGHTNING MCQUEEN" on it.
Guido quickly uncorks three wine bottles.
McQueen turns back to the phone.
The place ERUPTS IN CHEERS.
MOMENTS LATER - General excitement as McQueen exits the phone booth where Sally waits.
Off her look: 20.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: But we won't be long and ---

dialogue.name: SALLY
dialogue.s: Oh, no, don't worry about me.
I've got enough to do here.
Mater's going to have a blast though.
(off McQueen's silence) You're bringing Mater, right?
You never bring him to any of your races.

meta.s: McQueen turns to the bar where Mater privately tries their drinks, hates it, spits it back in the glass.

dialogue.name: SALLY
dialogue.s: Just let him sit in the pits, give him a headset.
C'mon, it'll be a thrill of a lifetime for him.

meta.s: Mater arrives.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: How'd you like to come and see the world with me?

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: You got me into this thing.

dialogue.name: BEGIN MONTAGE:
dialogue.s: - McQueen is given a new paint job and headlights by Ramone.
Mater, now sporting a "Team McQueen" emblem, seems psyched as well.

meta.s: - An airport DEPARTURES SIGN advertises the next flight: Tokyo, Japan.
- Mater waves goodbye with his hook alongside McQueen, Guido, Luigi, Fillmore and Sarge as --- 21.
--- the rest of Radiator Springs watches them board a plane.
Red bawls.
- IN THE JET, LATER.
McQueen and Mater are the only ones awake, watch an insane Japanese game show.
- JAPAN AT NIGHT.
A stylish Tokyo cityscape of neon, glamour, scrolling billboards, vending machines and high-tech skyscrapers.
- INSIDE A SOUVENIR SHOP loaded with McQueen toys: Mater and McQueen enter.
A tourist sees McQueen and faints.
- A KABUKI THEATER.
Team McQueen watches a methodical dance.
Mater, dressed in Kabuki makeup, arrives.
He looks insane.
- A SUMO MATCH - Two SUZUKI SAMURAI CARS wrestle over a parking space.
Mater, now in his element, cheers.
The MONTAGE ENDS on this high note as we ---
---- TEAM MCQUEEN, as they roll up the red carpet.
Press is held at bay behind ropes.
WORLD GRAND PRIX and ALLINOL logos are strategically placed for maximum press exposure.
RACERS are interviewed by press behind the red-carpet ropes.
Team McQueen enters via a second floor landing which overlooks a massive indoor party in a converted museum.
As they roll down a ramp to the party, they are awed.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Okay now Mater, remember: best behavior.

meta.s: He sees something, peels away.
It's fellow racers JEFF GORVETTE and LEWIS HAMILTON.
McQueen now has no choice but to let Mater go.
MATER as he approaches a GLASS-ENCLOSED ROCK GARDEN where a pitty RAKES rocks with precision.
He knocks on the glass with his hook.
People turn at the noise he's making.

dialogue.name: LEWIS HAMILTON
dialogue.s: I wonder who that guy's with?

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Will you guys excuse me just for one little second?

meta.s: He zips over to Mater's side, quickly pulls him out of sight.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Boy, that jet-lag really done a number on you.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Mater, look -- things are different over here.
Which means maybe you should, you know, act a little different too.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Well, just... help me out here, buddy.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Shoot, why didn't you just say so?
That's what a tow truck does.
Hey, looky there, it's Mr. San Francisco!

meta.s: FRANCESCO is visible across the room, holding court.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (already on his way) Look at me -- I'm helping you already!

meta.s: On FRANCESCO - MOMENTS LATER.
Mater approaches, giddy.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Hey Mr. San Francisco, I'd like you to meet ---

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: Yeah, nice to meet you too.
Not as good as I thought, but you're good.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Can I get a picture with you?

meta.s: As Mater poses for a photo with Francesco:

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Miss Sally is gonna flip when she sees this.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: She's a big fan of yours.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I wouldn't say she's a "big" fan.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: She goes on and on about your open wheels here.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Mentioning it once doesn't qualify as going "on and on."

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: Francesco is familiar with this reaction to Francesco.
Women respect a car that has nothing to hide.

meta.s: McQueen doesn't like where this is going, covers.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: (raising a drink) I dedicate my win tomorrow... to Miss Sally.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I already dedicated MY win tomorrow to her.
So if we both do it, it's really not so special.
Besides, I don't have a drink.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You mind if I borrow a few bucks for one of them drinks?

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well, shoot, what am I doing here?

meta.s: Mater ZIPS OFF.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I should probably go keep an eye on him.

meta.s: McQueen starts to leave.
Francesco does a 180, so his rear end now faces McQueen.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: You will see him like this, as he drives away from you.

meta.s: Francesco wears a bumper sticker that says "Ciao, McQueen!"

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: So you had one of those made up for all the racers?

meta.s: He rolls off.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: He is so getting beat tomorrow.

meta.s: Lights caress the main stage where a crowd has formed.

dialogue.name: VOICE
dialogue.s: Ladies and gentlecars... Sir Miles Axlerod!

meta.s: MILES AXLEROD drives through an infinity fountain, appears.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: It is my absolute honor to introduce to you the competitors in the first-ever World Grand Prix.

meta.s: ON FINN MCMISSILE.
He appears from the shadows, keeps a careful distance from the stage.
He ZEROES HIS GAZE ON --- --- THE WORLD GRAND PRIX TV CAMERAS which roll, catching Miles Axlerod's speech for publicity and posterity.
Finn's ONBOARD COMPUTER ANALYZES each one, compares to the photos we saw him snap on the oil platform.
Each one is "NOT A MATCH."
His view is suddenly disrupted by A BEAUTIFUL SPORTS CAR.
She approaches Finn.
Meet HOLLEY SHIFTWELL.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: A Volkswagen Karmann Ghia has no radiator.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: I'm Agent Shiftwell, Holley Shiftwell from the Tokyo Station.
I have a message from London.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: (LOUDLY) You must try the canapes on the mezzanine!

meta.s: He moves her onto an elevator.
The doors close on them.
IN THE ELEVATOR, GOING UP.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: So the lab boys analyzed the photo I sent?
What did they learn about the camera?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: It appears to be a standard television camera.
They said if you could get closer photos next time, that would be great.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Um, the oil platforms you were on?
Turns out they're sitting on the biggest oil reserve in the world.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: The Americans actually discovered it just before you did.
They placed an agent on that platform, under deep cover.
He was able to get a photo of the car who's running the entire operation.

meta.s: The doors OPEN and they exit onto the Mezzanine.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Has anyone seen the photo yet?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: The American is here tonight to pass it to you.
He'll signal you when he's ready.

meta.s: FINN
Professor Zundapp is visible below them.
He talks with a few Pacers and Gremlins.
Finn quickly retreats into the shadows.
Holley follows suit.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Those thugs down there were on the oil platform.
If they see me, the whole mission is compromised.

meta.s: MATER as he grabs a drink, keeps moving.
He snatches it, drops it in the back where we now see a large assortment of drinks balanced.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Never know which one McQueen'll have a hankering for.

meta.s: He approaches a sushi bar.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Hey, what you got here that's free?
How about that pistachio ice cream?

meta.s: He refers to wasabi, of course.
The chef starts to carve a small scoop aside for Mater.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (the chef adds more) Keep it coming.
Come on, let's go, it's free!

meta.s: The chef gives in.
Scoops a baseball-sized ball out.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Now THAT's a scoop of ice cream.

dialogue.name: CUT BACK TO:
dialogue.s: MILES AXLEROD - He's now nearly done with his intros.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: ... and now, our last competitor --- Number 95, Lightning McQueen!

meta.s: MCQUEEN approaches the microphone, flashes his headlights.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Thank you so much for having us, Sir Axlerod.
I really look forward to racing.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: Oh, the pleasure is all ours, Lightning.
You and your team bring excellence and professionalism to this competition.

meta.s: As if on cue, Mater arrives with a piercing scream of pain.
Everyone turns as he charges head first toward the stage, making a bee-line for that FOUNTAIN.
He laps up water from the fountain like a diabetic cat.
Miles Axlerod is shocked.
The crowd can't believe it.
Francesco cackles.
Mater, now sated, approaches the mic.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (to the crowd) Whatever you do, do not eat the free pistachio ice cream.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: This is the bloke that called into the television show.
(TO MATER) You're the one I have to thank.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: (TO MCQUEEN) He's a little excited, isn't he?

meta.s: TILT DOWN to reveal a pool of oil beneath Mater.
McQueen quickly pulls Mater aside, out of earshot of Miles Axlerod and the others.
McQueen is beside himself.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Mater, you have to get a hold of yourself.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Go take care of yourself right now.

meta.s: Mater drives off.

dialogue.name: ON MATER - MOMENTS LATER
dialogue.s: He drives through the party, frantic.

meta.s: Someone points Mater down a hallway.
He whips around the

dialogue.name: CORNER ---
dialogue.s: Finds himself in front of TWO BATHROOM DOORS, neither of which clearly indicate MALE or FEMALE.

meta.s: Mater chooses one, drives inside.
A SHRIEK is heard and Mater zips out.
He heads into the other door ---
Mater rolls in, still `holding it in' like a kid.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I never leak I never leak I never leak...

meta.s: He sees someone leaving a stall.
He heads in.
IN THE STALL - Mater enters, looks up.
The stall is a complicated apparatus with buttons and lights.
High-tech Japanese.
It suddenly GRABS MATER, hoists him up as if he's going to get an oil change.
A Japanese style cartoon CARICATURE appears on a TV MONITOR, followed by images of waterfalls and rivers.
The caricature starts talking in Japanese.
Suddenly WATER FIRES UP underneath Mater's undercarriage, goosing him.
He freaks out.
OUTSIDE THE STALL - With Mater's yells audible we see a GREMLIN enter, furtive.
Suddenly, inexplicably, his frame BREAKS APART like an egg, revealing an AMERICAN MUSCLE CAR underneath.
The pieces of the Gremlin disappear under him, clearly his disguise.
This is ROD REDLINE - American Agent.
HOLLEY, rolls along by herself.
Nervous.
DING!
Her rearview monitor springs to life.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY (INTO RADIO)
dialogue.s: The American has activated his tracking beacon.

meta.s: Rod Redline, waiting at a sink, feels a presence behind him.
GREM and ACER have entered, hesitate briefly when they see Rod Redline.
Rod Redline, careful, slides a gun out of his tire.
He is suddenly CHARGED by the AMCs --- Rod SPINS AROUND and gets a shot off but is SLAMMED HEAD FIRST.
A TIGHT, CLOSE-QUARTERS FIGHT begins --- IN THE STALL - Mater, still TRAPPED, is now being SCRUBBED as if in a car wash.
He is helpless.
OUTSIDE THE STALL - Rod is being pulverized.
Just when he scrambles away from one car, the other one takes over.

IN THE STALL - Mater is mercifully released, but when he backs out --- --- Rod Redline is THROWN INTO MATER'S STALL DOOR, crunching it and sending Mater --- --- BACK INTO THE CLUTCHES of the insane toilet.
Holley isolates the tracking beacon's location in the party.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Oh, you've got to be joking.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: I can't just go into the men's loo.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Time is of the essence, Shiftwell.

meta.s: Rod Redline is in bad shape.
He backs away, betrays a look of concern.
He's in trouble here.
ACER burns rubber, ready to finish him off.
Just as he shifts into DRIVE --- --- MATER'S STALL DOOR KICKS OPEN, knocking ACER out.
Mater jumps out, face-to-face GREM.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (out of breath) Whatever you do, I would not go in there.

meta.s: The door SWINGS shut, revealing the pulverized Acer.
Rod Redline, now behind Mater and sensing an opportunity here, quickly produces A SMALL DEVICE.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (to Grem and Acer) No offense to your makes and models, but you guys break down harder than my cousin Betsy after she got left at the ---

meta.s: Rod Redline, surreptitiously attaches the device to Mater's undercarriage.
He spins around, sees Rod Redline for the first time.
Mater turns back to Grem and Acer.

dialogue.name: GREM
dialogue.s: We'd like to get to our private business here, if you don't mind.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Don't let me get in the way of your "private business."
A little advice: When you hear her giggle and see that waterfall, you best press that green button.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Remember it's in Celsius, not Fahrenheit.

meta.s: Mater exits, leaving Rod Redline to a now even angrier Grem and Acer.
Holley arrives at the door.
She takes a breath, is about to enter when Mater EXITS.
He passes her, expelling some exhaust in the process.
Holley's rearview tracking confirms that the device is on him.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (driving off, to himself) Look out, ladies.

meta.s: It's settled.
Holley takes one more nervous breath, quickly closes the distance between her and Mater, cuts him off.
He is forced to STOP.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: A Volkswagen Karmann Ghia has no radiator.

meta.s: OF THE---

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Course, Karmann Ghia's weren't the only ones.
Besides the Beetles you had your Type-3 Squarebacks, with the pancake motors...

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: ... And before both of them, there's the Type-2 buses - my buddy Fillmore's one of them.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: We should find somewhere more private.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Don't you think that's a little, uh ---

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Impossible to know which areas here are compromised.
So, when can I see you again?

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Tomorrow I'll be out there at the races.

meta.s: Mater returns to his team, lost in thought.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well, what's going on is I've got me a date tomorrow.

meta.s: Guido makes a crack in Italian.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: My new girlfriend just said so.

meta.s: Mater points out Holley, who's within earshot.
Holley, caught in plain view, DRIVES OFF.
Guido makes another crack in Italian.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. SHIPYARD - THE DOCKS - TOKYO NIGHT

meta.s: An industrial dock, outside of the city proper.
Rod Redline dangles from a car magnet.
He's been beaten up, clings to consciousness.
Grem, Acer, and a bunch of nasty looking troublemakers look up at Rod amidst crates and shipping containers.

dialogue.name: ACER
dialogue.s: And we don't like being tricked.

meta.s: Rod Redline laughs to himself.

dialogue.name: ROD REDLINE
dialogue.s: Well, you know, I was just wearing a disguise.
You guys are stuck looking like that.

meta.s: This doesn't help him.
They DROP HIM onto a TREADMILL, lock him down.
A container is wheeled forward and Rod is plied with Allinol brand gasoline.

dialogue.name: ROD REDLINE
dialogue.s: I hear this stuff is good for you.

meta.s: The Professor emerges from the darkness, behind Rod.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: Allinol by itself is good for you.

meta.s: Zundapp hits a button and the TREADMILL starts Rod's wheels spinning at a high rate of speed.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: But after microscopic examination, I have found that it has one small weakness.
When hit with an electromagnetic pulse, it becomes extremely dangerous.

meta.s: GREM

dialogue.name: SMILE ---
dialogue.s: Grem pushes a World Grand Prix CAMERA - the same one that was in the box back at the oil derrick.
He points it at Rod Redline.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: You were very interested in this camera on the oil platform.
Now you will witness what it really does.

meta.s: Acer pushes a TV MONITOR toward Rod.
On it, surveillance footage from the party.
Clearly, they were watching and recording him there.

dialogue.name: ACER
dialogue.s: You talked up a lot of cars last night.

dialogue.name: ROD REDLINE
dialogue.s: You know, I can't tell them apart these days.

dialogue.name: GREM
dialogue.s: (HAD ENOUGH) Could I start it now, Professor?

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: (to Rod Redline) This camera is actually an electromagnetic pulse emitter.

dialogue.name: ACER
dialogue.s: (re: a girl on the TV) What about her?
Did you give it to her?

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: The Allinol is now heating to a boil, dramatically expanding, causing the engine block to crack under the stress, forcing oil into the combustion chamber.

meta.s: Rod Redline's engine starts to CRACK and BREAK.

dialogue.name: ACER
dialogue.s: (re: a guy on the TV) How about him?

dialogue.name: ROD REDLINE
dialogue.s: (to Professor Zundapp) What do I care?
I can replace an engine block.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: You may be able to, but after full impact of the pulse, unfortunately, there will be nothing to replace.

meta.s: The monitor reveals MATER, rolling out of the bathroom and down the hall.
Rod Redline, seeing this, does the world's most subtle double take.
We caught it, but there's no way anyone else in the room could have ---
As Grem turns up the machine even MORE, the Professor makes a call.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP (INTO PHONE)
dialogue.s: We believe the infiltrator has passed along sensitive information.
(beat, listening) I will take care of it before any damage can be done.

meta.s: The Professor hangs up, turns to the room.

dialogue.name: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP
dialogue.s: The project is still on schedule.
You will find this second agent ---

meta.s: Zundapp kicks the camera's power into the RED.
On the MONITOR - With Mater's frozen image on the screen we see Rod EXPLODE in the reflection.
Over television pre-roll of Japan:

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Where ancient tradition meets modern technology.
Welcome to the inaugural running of the World Grand Prix.

meta.s: ON OUR ANNOUNCERS as they introduce themselves:

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER
dialogue.s: I'm Brent Mustangburger, here with racing legends Darrell Cartrip and David Hobbscap.
There's never been a competition like this before.

meta.s: SHOTS OF THE PITS as the racers fuel up.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: First, Allinol, making its debut tonight as the required fuel for all these great champions.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.) (CONT'D)
dialogue.s: Second, the course itself, and it's like nothing we've ever seen.
David, how exactly does this competition work?

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Well, Brent, all three of these street courses are classic round- the-house racetracks.

meta.s: OUTLINES OF THREE RACE COURSES are shown.
They're labeled Japan, Italy and England, and are different in shape and size.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: This means that the LMP and Formula cars should break out of the gate in spectacular fashion.

meta.s: SHOTS OF THE RACERS as they weave up the track, practicing.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Look for Francesco Bernoulli in particular to lead early.

meta.s: SHOTS OF Francesco, featured in an inset.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: And with a series of technical turns throughout ---

meta.s: MORE SHOTS of the course, now highlighting the tech turns.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: GT and Touring cars like Spain's Miguel Camino should make up some ground but I doubt it'll be enough to stop Francesco from absolutely running away with it.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Woah, now just hold your horsepower.
You're forgetting the most important factor here.
That early dirt track section of the course!
The dirt is supposed to be the great equalizer in this race.

meta.s: GRAPHICS OF THE COURSES now isolate a stretch after the first couple turns, label it "DIRT SECTIONS."

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: French Rally car Raoul ÇaRoule is counting on a big boost headed through there.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: His mentor, the Hudson Hornet, was one of the greatest dirt track racers of all time.
In my opinion, McQueen is the best all-around racer in this competition.

meta.s: BACK IN THE STUDIO

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP
dialogue.s: Really, Darrell, I think you need to clean your windshield.
You're clearly not seeing this for what it is: Francesco's race to lose.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: The racers are locking into the grid ---

meta.s: Engines rev as everyone gets ready to go.
Everyone's bright eyed and alert except for McQueen who we find in the back of the grid.
He CLOSES his eyes.
A LAUGH O.S.
McQueen opens his eyes.
Francesco is next to him on the grid.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: It's really getting him into the zone!

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: He is so getting beat today.

meta.s: The starting lights click down from RED to YELLOW to GREEN.
The race begins.
Francesco quickly grabs the lead.
He's pulling away within seconds.
ON PIT ROW - We TRACK PAST as the various Crew Chiefs on their crash carts bark orders to their racers.
We end on Team McQueen.
No Crew Chief, just a solid looking team.
The same view of Mater but now THROUGH A TELESCOPIC DISPLAY.
Reveal Finn and Holley watching from high above in a downtown office building, behind reflective glass.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Why is he in the pits?

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: One of the best I've seen, too.
Look at the detail on that rust.
It must have cost him a fortune.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: But why hasn't he contacted us yet?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: He'll signal us when he can.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: And then we find out who's behind all this.

meta.s: ON THE TRACK - VARIOUS SHOTS OF THE RACE through Tokyo as Francesco extends his lead and McQueen attempts to make up ground.
IN MCQUEEN'S PIT - Mater watches the monitors, sees them approaching the dirt section.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: It's time to make your move.
Get on the outside and show 'em what Doc done taught you.

meta.s: ON THE TRACK - Francesco hits the dirt section and loses all control.
He SLAMS to a halt, his tires getting no traction.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Francesco is brought to a screeching halt!

meta.s: MCQUEEN skids into view, turning right to go left, passing Francesco, followed by other cars ---

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Lightning McQueen is the first to take advantage.
And just like that, folks, Francesco's lead is left in the dust.

meta.s: McQueen now leads the pack, zooming out of the dirt now starting to relax.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Man, McQueen looks happier than a rollbar at a demolition derby!

dialogue.name: ON PAVED ROAD AGAIN - MOMENTS LATER
dialogue.s: The field of cars thunders into a tunnel.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Everyone's jostling for position as we hit the asphalt again.

meta.s: Francesco crests the hill, in last place.
He bites down, determined, then CHASES.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Francesco lost a lot of momentum in the dirt.
He's got some serious work ahead of him if he wants to get back in this race.

meta.s: VARIOUS SHOTS OF TOKYO as the racers move through the Rainbow Bridge.
Bit by bit, Francesco ekes his way toward the front, toward Lightning McQueen as we --- --- A ROOFTOP, and a VIEW THROUGH THE WGP CAMERA LENS.
Grem and Acer are manning this one.
They focus it on the racers as they approach.
ON THE TRACK - A racer (Miguel Camino) suddenly PLUMES WITH SMOKE and skids out.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Miguel Camino has blown an engine!

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: He's been so consistent all year.

meta.s: Camino quickly pits, passing McQueen's pit where Mater is visible.
ON GREM AND ACER, watching from above.

dialogue.name: GREM
dialogue.s: It's that tow truck from the bathroom.

dialogue.name: GREM
dialogue.s: Yeah, the one the American Agent passed the device to.

meta.s: Acer exits, with purpose.
ON FINN AND HOLLEY, still in their office hideaway.
Holley's onboard computer flashes an ALERT.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: The Pacer from the party last night.

meta.s: She's spotted Acer, moving swiftly forward.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Cross-referencing with the photos from the oil derricks... Yep.

meta.s: The computer finds more and more bad guy Pacers and Gremlins are in the crowd.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: He's not the only one here.
And they're all closing in on... oh no.

meta.s: We PAN OVER to see it's MATER.
She turns.
He's GONE, leaving only an open window.

dialogue.name: FINN (OVER RADIO)
dialogue.s: Get him out of the pits now!

meta.s: IN MCQUEEN'S PIT.
A car WHIPS BY O.S.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Some of them fellers is really loud.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY (OVER MATER'S RADIO)
dialogue.s: Get out of the pit now.

meta.s: Mater realizes this girl has somehow broken into his radio.

dialogue.name: MATER (INTO RADIO)
dialogue.s: You're that girl from the party last night.
You wanna do our date right now?

meta.s: ON THE TRACK - McQueen boxes out Francesco, holds his slim lead, but barely.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Guys, a little too much chatter.

meta.s: BOOM!
A racer behind McQueen suddenly expels black smoke, skids out of control.
ON GREM - laughing.
That was clearly his handiwork.
IN MCQUEEN'S PIT - SAME

dialogue.name: HOLLEY (ON MATER'S RADIO)
dialogue.s: There's no time for messing about.
You've got to get out of the pits.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Is there gonna be cable where you is so I can watch the rest of the race?

meta.s: ON HOLLEY - Watching from the downtown building.
We CUT BACK TO --- --- MATER.
He gives in, exits the pit.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well, all right but I usually like to have a proper detailing done before I meet a lady friend.

meta.s: He moves toward the back PIT DOOR, is about to open it.
OUTSIDE THE PITS - ACER and another Pacer approach McQueen's pit door on the other side.
Ready to pounce.
The doors OPEN,

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Then this shouldn't hurt at all.

meta.s: He empties the extinguisher in their eyes, speeds past.
They try and follow, but have been blinded.
One of them crashes right into a COP.
ON FINN - Already on the move, along a side street.
ON HOLLEY - Tracking everything on a grid map.
Mater looks like Pac Man, weaving through the streets as bad guys close in all around him.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: I've got him in the back alleys east of the garages.
Multiple assailants are closing in quickly.

meta.s: ON MATER - He turns a corner, sees a flower shop.
ON THE TRACK - McQueen, hearing this, is taken aback.
ON MATER - Slowing at the flower shop.
ON THE TRACK
McQueen drifts outside allowing Francesco to slip past!

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I cannot believe what I just saw, Brent.
You don't open up the inside like that!

meta.s: IN THE BACK ALLEYS - As Mater moves on he's followed by Pacers and Gremlins.
Suddenly --- --- CABLES whip in front of them, pulling over flower vending machines and sending the shop's owners into a frenzy.
They direct their attention to the AMCs, who try and explain.
ON FINN, admiring his handiwork as he appears.
Just as he turns to leave he's BROADSIDED and pushed INTO A DARK ALLEY.
IN THE ALLEY - Finn finds himself boxed by two Pacers and pushed toward --- --- ACER, who now holds a FLAME THROWER.

dialogue.name: ACER
dialogue.s: This time I'm gonna make sure you stay dead.

meta.s: He hits the flame.
WHOOOSSSH!!
ON ANOTHER STREET - Mater clicks along, still looking for Holley.
Just as he passes the alley entrance where Finn stares down death:

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You want me to head toward that ruckus?

meta.s: Mater turns INTO the alley.
IN THE ALLEY - Finn, now nearly pushed completely into the flame thrower, leaps into the air.
He FIGHTS BACK, using his wheels, axle, indeed his entire car frame as if he were human, kicking and tossing and shooting his enemies.
Mater witnesses the whole thing.
ON THE TRACK - McQueen, now playing catch-up again, scowls.
IN THE BACK ALLEY - Finn polishes off the AMCs by firing a bullet into a gas main line, causing an EXPLOSION that tosses Acer through the air where he lands in a NOODLE SHOP'S SIGN.
ON THE TRACK - The end of the race is nigh ---

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: They're bumper to bumper as they approach the finish line!

meta.s: The Formula car gets there first.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Francesco's the winner, McQueen's number two!

meta.s: IN THE ALLEY - Finn heaves breaths, surveys his damage.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Hey, can I get your autograph?

meta.s: Mater approaches when a MASS OF RACE FANS burst out a door, momentarily blocking Mater's view of Finn.
Once the fans have past, Finn has disappeared.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Dadgum, did I miss our date?

meta.s: Post race press conference.
Francesco is center stage.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP
dialogue.s: Hey, what was your strategy today?

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: Francesco needs no strategy, it's very simple.
You start the race, wait for Lightning McQueen to choke, pass him, then win.

meta.s: McQueen, waiting in the wings, rolls his eyes.
He suddenly notices something O.S.
McQueen's P.O.V.
- It's MATER, appearing from a side street, moving toward the pits, oblivious of the press conference.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP
dialogue.s: (TO FRANCESCO) I gotta tell you, dude.
You were in trouble for awhile.
That dirt track section had you crawling!

meta.s: As McQueen SNEAKS AWAY ---

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: To truly crush one's dream, you must first raise their hopes very high.

meta.s: IN MCQUEEN'S PIT GARAGE - Mater looks around for everyone as McQueen approaches.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: Mater, why were you yelling things at me while I was racing?

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Oh, you thought... that's funny right there.
Nah, see that's `cause I seen these two fellers doing some sort of karate street performance.
One of them even had a flamethrower ---

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: She started talking to me as a voice in my head, telling me where to go ---

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Wait a minute -- I didn't screw you up, did I?

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I lost the race because of you!

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: This is exactly why I don't bring you along to these things.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Maybe if I, I don't know, talked to somebody and explained what happened I could help.

meta.s: The press finds McQueen, swarms him.
Mater is pushed backwards as the questions fly again.

dialogue.name: PRESS
dialogue.s: - McQueen, you had it in the bag!

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: But I can assure you, it won't happen again.

meta.s: On Mater.
He takes this badly.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: We know what the problem is and we've taken care of it.

dialogue.name: SMASH TO:
dialogue.s: OVER FOOTAGE OF FRANCESCO and various other highlights:

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER
dialogue.s: Lightning McQueen loses in the last lap to Francesco Bernoulli in the first race of the World Grand Prix and three, count em, three cars flamed out leading some to suggest that their fuel, Allinol, might be to blame.

meta.s: FOOTAGE OF MILES AXLEROD, speaking to an aggressive press.
He must SHOUT over the press.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: There is no way my fuel caused these cars to flame out!

meta.s: IN THE TV STUDIO - Darrell, Brent and David talk to camera.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP
dialogue.s: Well the jury may still be out on whether Allinol caused these accidents, but one thing's for sure: Lightning McQueen blew this race.

meta.s: Off a FROZEN IMAGE of McQueen crossing the finish line, a look of severe consternation across his face ---

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER
dialogue.s: Team McQueen can't be happy right now.

meta.s: --- MATCH ---
--- McQueen's SMILING FACE, on a Team McQueen poster.
REVERSE to reveal Mater looking at it, sadly.
He drives on, passing (but not noticing) --- --- GREM and ACER.
AT THE SECURITY CHECK - MOMENTS LATER.
Cars take off their tires, move through the metal detector.
Mater waits in line.
A SECURITY CAR approaches Mater.

dialogue.name: SECURITY CAR
dialogue.s: (in Japanese and English) Come with me please, sir.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: But I'm gonna miss my plane.

meta.s: IN THE ADMIRAL'S LOUNGE - MOMENTS LATER.
The Security Car leads Mater inside.
As they move past us the Security Car covertly drops a BALL BEARING which rolls into a corner.
The ball bearing then sprouts MECHANICAL LEGS, tripods itself and IRISES out, revealing itself to be a tiny CAMERA.

dialogue.name: IN THE MAIN ROOM - ADMIRAL'S LOUNGE - CONTINUOUS
dialogue.s: Mater follows the Security Car in, nervous.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: This is about my hook, isn't it?
I know I should've checked it, but I can't really, look -- it's attached to me.

meta.s: ZWAPPPPPP!!
The Security Car suddenly DECLOAKS himself, reveals himself to be Finn McMissile!

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You're that feller from the karate demonstration.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Let's just say I'm triple-A affiliated.
You know, I know some karate.
I don't wanna brag or nothing, but I've got me a black fan belt.

meta.s: BEEP!
Finn's rearview alarms.
His camera has picked up Grem and Acer.
They've just entered the lounge, are right around the corner.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Hey, you wanna see some moves I made up?

meta.s: Finn quickly turns, fires a tiny GLASS CUTTING BEETLE at the window.
As Mater talks, oblivious, the beetle cuts out a round hole.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: This first one I can reach into a car's hood, pull out his battery, and show it to him before he stalls.
I call it, "What I accidentally did to my friend Luigi once."

meta.s: Mater does his best (worst) karate moves as Acer and Grem turn the corner.
The glass drops away, leaving a car-sized hole.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (eyes the clock) Look, I probably ought to go.
I'm about to miss my flight.

meta.s: Finn HOOKS Mater from behind.
He YANKS HIM forward ---
--- and LEAPS OUT THE WINDOW!
Finn pulls Mater down HARD onto the tarmac, towing him away from the terminal.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You don't even have to go through the terminal.

meta.s: ACER and GREM appear, chasing them.
Mater, who is facing backward as he is being pulled along, faces them.
They're about a hundred yards back.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (TO FINN) Your karate partners are back here.
They kinda look like they're trying to catch up!

meta.s: Finn SKIDS around, whipping Mater in a 180 so that Mater is now towing Finn.
Grem produces a ROCKET, lines up Finn as his target.
Finn, without hesitation, fires a MINI ROLLING-JACK.
The jack DRIVES ITSELF toward Grem, anchors itself under his frame and flips him like a turtle but not before Grem gets the rocket

dialogue.name: OFF ---
dialogue.s: THE ROCKET - it flies toward Mater and Finn.

meta.s: FINN aims and launches a MISSILE back.
THE ROCKET AND MISSILE COLLIDE IN MID-AIR, EXPLODE.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (only hearing this) Is everything okay back there?

meta.s: A GULFSTREAM JET wings into view overhead.
This is SIDDELEY.
Mater looks up: ACER screeches into view up ahead, dragging a long row of luggage carts in Mater's path, attempting to create an accident.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (TO FINN) You remember that whole thing about me not stopping no matter what?

meta.s: Just as it looks dire --- RATATATATATATAT!!!
SIDDELEY descends, hawklike, fires bullets and blows the luggage carts sky-high.
Mater and Finn burst through them, luggage now raining down from above.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I knew I should've done carry-on!

meta.s: Siddeley LANDS HARD on the tarmac ahead of them.
No time to stop, he DROPS his back open, revealing HOLLEY.
Mater SPEEDS UP toward Siddeley's ramp, Holley.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (TO HOLLEY) Boy I tell you what, you really do want this first date, don't ya?
That's a no-quit attitude right there.

meta.s: Just as Mater's wheels touch the ramp, BULLETS PING around him in a spray.
Siddeley is HIT, a tire BLOWN.
He yells in pain.
Siddeley peels off the runway onto the grass.
A gunfight ensues between Finn and Acer.
Finn SHOOTS ACER'S TIRE, blowing it and throwing him off-course.
Acer CAREENS out of control, drives up and THROUGH A JET --- --- OUT THE OTHER SIDE where he lands in an oil tanker.
ON SIDDELEY - He's headed toward the edge of the tarmac, where the grass and runway meet WATER.
He HITS THE GAS, his only hope.
Finn BRAKES, 180s and grabs the ramp just as Siddeley gets air.
Mater, the only thing not in the jet, dangles and recedes from our view as Siddeley climbs toward the clouds.
As he's PULLED in through the back hatch:

dialogue.name: MATER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: By the time you read this, I will be safely on an airplane, flying home.

meta.s: CLOSE ON a handwritten (er, tire-written?)
NOTE in childish scrawl.
We don't see all of it, only a bit.
Mater's voice O.S.
begins the note with the first sentence, but we DISSOLVE into McQueen's voice.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: "I'm so sorry for what I did.
I don't want to be the cause of you losing any more races.
I want you to go prove to the world what I already know - that you are the greatest race car in the whole wide world.

meta.s: McQueen takes this in.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I didn't really want him to leave.

dialogue.name: LUIGI
dialogue.s: Please tell the hotel I didn't mean to order that movie.
I thought it was just a preview and I didn't realize I was paying for it.

dialogue.name: PP."
dialogue.s: (to the others) There's a few more pages of P.S.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: (TURNING BACK) Well, at least I know if he's at home he'll be safe.

meta.s: SIDDELEY breaks through some cloud cover, flies with purpose.
A well-appointed spy jet.
Various computers line the walls.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Now that's how I like to start the day!
You never feel more alive than when you're almost dead.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: (SCANNING MATER) I hope that device didn't fall off.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: That's the closest I ever been to missing my flight!

meta.s: With a ROBOTIC ARM, Holley grabs the THE DEVICE that Rod Redline hid under Mater.
She yanks it out with a GOOSE.
Holley drops the device into a mainframe computer.
It starts "ANALYZING."

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I gotta go to a doctor.
I keep getting these sharp pains in my undercarriage.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (TO HOLLEY) This here is Finn McSomething-or- other.
He's a First Class VIP airport whatchamacallit.
And Finn, this here's my date.
(TO HOLLEY) I never did get your name.

meta.s: DING!
The computer is done analyzing.
The cabin lights dim.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Time to see who's behind all this.

meta.s: AN IMAGE is blasted between the three of them.
It's of a photograph, a complicated melange of metallic parts stuck together.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well, that's one of the worst engines ever made.
It's an old aluminum V8 with a Lucas electrical system and Whitworth bolts.
Shoot, them Whitworth bolts is a pain, tell you what.
Them ain't metric, they ain't inches...

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: But who's engine is this, Mater?

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well, it's kinda hard to tell from this picture, ain't it?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: But you're the one who took it.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: "A good agent gets what he can, then gets out before he's killed."

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You mean like insurance agent, like, (SINGS) `Like a good neighbor, Mater is there'?

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Holley, in how many makes and models did this type of engine appear?

meta.s: Holley has these stats in seconds.
Kid's play.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: It was standard in seven models over a 12-year period.
At least 35,000 cars were made with this engine.

meta.s: Mater MOVES HIS SEAT FORWARD, through one part of the hologram so he's face-to-face with Holley.
She moves the engine photo so it's now blocking Mater again.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: This seems like a dead end.
If there were something in the photo that could narrow this down a bit I'd be a lot happier.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You might not be happy, but I bet this feller is.
See how he's had most of his parts replaced?
And see all them boxes over there?
They ain't easy to come by.

meta.s: Holley drops her screen down.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: I would never have seen that.
(TO HOLLEY) I know of a black-market parts dealer in Paris, a treacherous lowlife.
But, he's the only car in the world who can tell us whose engine this is.
Mater, what would you say to setting up an informal task force on this one?

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: You obviously have plenty of experience in the field.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Well yeah I live right next to one.
(thinks about it) I don't know, Finn.
I ain't exactly been much help to anybody recently.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: But you know I'm just a tow truck, right?

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: And I'm just in the import/export business.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Yeah, two of them sweets for me too, Sid!
(TO HOLLEY) You know, I always wanted to be a spy.

meta.s: Siddeley HITS THE JUICE, they kick forward like a mule as we --- A MONTAGE OF PARIS: Mater attempts to merge into roundabout traffic; mimes annoy tourists at the Eiffel Tower; a painter works his magic on an unattractive couple; a couple kisses on the most romantic spot in the world; we might even catch GASTOW'S RESTAURANT.
The charming, low-key introduction ends with a SWEEPING VISTA of Paris's center from far away as we CRANE DOWN INTO ---
--- a dirty street in the 1st Arrondissement.
Finn and Holley drive along together as Mater, playing "spy," darts back and forth behind them from doorway to dumpster, "hiding out."
He's having a ball.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: (TO HOLLEY) Once we're inside, stay close.
Don't bother checking VIN numbers for criminal records, they're all dodgy here.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: We're not here to go shopping.

meta.s: As Finn and Holley and Mater turn the corner...
Mater turns the corner and enters a massive Les Halles- inspired Parisian market filled with car parts.
A tow truck's dream.

dialogue.name: IN THE MARKET - MOMENTS LATER
dialogue.s: Mater rolls along, impressed by the goods for sale.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You gotta be kidding me - they've got everything here.

meta.s: Mater continues on though, heeding Finn's advice.
Mater, now out of sight of Finn and Holley, passes a darkened stall.
He STOPS, peers in.
There's someone in there.
It suddenly OPENS its headlights revealing...
EYES!!
In French, the mutant car pitches his wares to Mater.
Mater FREAKS OUT, speeds off, TERRIFIED.

dialogue.name: AROUND THE CORNER - FINN AND HOLLEY
dialogue.s: A few car lengths ahead of Mater.
They roll along, looking for... Aha!
Finn and Holley recede into the shadows.

meta.s: In FINN'S SIDE MIRROR: TOMBER, a three-wheeled parts dealer, argues with a French customer.
Mater suddenly turns the corner, sees Finn and Holley.
Too late.
Tomber sees Mater, then notices FINN, reflected in a hubcap.
He BOLTS.
Finn and Holley give chase.
Tomber, skidding away, kicks a tent in Finn's way.
Holley quickly pivots RIGHT and disappears.
Where did she go?
Finn, hot in pursuit, leaps another obstacle and loses ground

dialogue.name: TO ---
dialogue.s: --- Tomber who turns a corner and finds himself grill to grill with HOLLEY.
He whips to the left but TURNS OVER, rolling sideways and CRASHING to a stop.

meta.s: Holley ZAPS him with ELECTROSHOCKERS.
Finn suddenly arrives, stops her.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: (TO HOLLEY) Have you lost your mind?

meta.s: MOMENTS LATER - Mater tows Tomber, following Finn and Holley.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: You rusty piece of junk, get your dirty hook off me!

scene.sceneheader: INT. A SMALL GARAGE - MOMENTS LATER

meta.s: Finn throws open a door.
Cars scatter like cockroaches.
Mater unhooks an angry Tomber who spits in French.
Finn pulls the door down.
As it LATCHES TIGHT ---

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: This is her first field assignment - she didn't know you were my informant.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: I never liked new car- smell.

meta.s: Holley FUMES with anger.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Tomber was doing 20 to life in a Moroccan impound the first time I saved him, if I recall correctly.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: Speaking of recalls, you're getting up there in mileage aren't you, Finn?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: You both know each other, you're both old.

meta.s: Holley shoots a HOLOGRAPHIC PHOTO of the engine in front of Tomber.
Tomber eyes the photo.
He recoils, unimpressed.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: That is the worst motor ever made.

meta.s: Suddenly, Tomber narrows his gaze.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: That oil filter... those wheel bearings.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Do those parts look familiar, Tomber?

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: He's my best customer, but he always does his business over the phone.
I was always wondering why he needs so many parts.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Cars that don't ever work right.
Lemons is a tow truck's bread and butter.
Like them Gremlins and Pacers we run into at the party and the race and the airport.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Holley, pull up the pictures from the oil platform.
I want to know what other type of cars were out there.

meta.s: Holley complies and suddenly PHOTOS OF CARS FROM THE OIL PLATFORM hang suspended in the air in front of them.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Mater, are these cars considered lemons?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Everyone involved in this plot is one of history's biggest loser cars.

meta.s: Holley refers to the ENGINE PHOTO, which now rises forward as the prominent picture, perhaps the only one in view.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: And they're all taking their orders from the car behind this engine.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: Gremlin, Pacer, Hugo and Trunkovs never get together.
But they're having a secret meeting in two days.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: That's where the next race is!

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Then there's a good chance our mystery engine will be there too.

dialogue.name: TOMBER
dialogue.s: Your chances are more than good.
I just sent him a new clutch assembly yesterday... to Porto Corsa.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Holley, contact Stephenson and have him meet us at Gare de Lyon.

meta.s: STEPHENSON, a THREE-CAR LUXURY BULLET TRAIN speeds along a snow-covered mountain in the dead of night, its halogen headlight cutting through the darkness.
It DIPS into a
TUNNEL ---

dialogue.name: MATER (O.S.)
dialogue.s: That three- wheeled feller had to be right about a big meeting.

meta.s: Mater, Finn and Holley scroll through surveillance-style photos of TRAFFIC on an Italian street.
They're in the front train car, which doubles as a luxury seating area and intelligence command center.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: You never see this many lemons in one town.
Unless there's a swap meet, or something.

dialogue.name: MATER (CONT'D)
dialogue.s: Hey, how'd you get all them pictures?

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: Well, I remotely reprogrammed Porto Corsa's red light cameras to do recognition scans.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Wow, not only is you the prettiest car I ever met, but you the smartest too.

meta.s: Mater refers to a photo of VICTOR HUGO, the HUGO Lemonhead, being towed by an EASTERN EUROPEAN TOW TRUCK.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: They must be the heads of the lemon families.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: If I was rich and broke down every day, I'd hire me to tow me around all the time too.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: We've got to infiltrate that meeting.
It's the only way to find out who's behind all this.

meta.s: Holley SNAPS Mater's picture, temporarily blinding him.
Holley turns back to her monitor.
Mater's face appears on screen.
She quickly GRAFTS it over the Hugo's tow truck's.
Holley isn't sure what surprises her more: the compliment or how pleased it makes her.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: Boy, I sure wish my friends could see me now.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. SMALL TOWN - ITALY - OUTSIDE PORTO CORSA - DAY

meta.s: A quaint Italian piazza.
A pristine MASERATI FOUNTAIN, complete with ancient trident, looms in our view.
Luigi and Guido roll into view.

dialogue.name: LUIGI
dialogue.s: Guido, your eyes do not deceive you.

meta.s: Sarge, Fillmore and McQueen exit a WGP transport truck.

dialogue.name: FILLMORE
dialogue.s: Which way to the hotel, man?

dialogue.name: LUIGI
dialogue.s: No friends of mine will stay in a hotel in my village.
You will stay with my --- Uncle Topolino!

meta.s: UNCLE TOPOLINO, a distinguished 1937 Fiat Topolino, rolls forward.
He greets them warmly with affectionate Italian salutations as word of Guido and Luigi's arrival spreads.
The square FILLS with family and friends.
A festive homecoming party.
Lights strung across the square.
Music and dancing.
Fillmore and Sarge are at a dining table.

dialogue.name: SARGE
dialogue.s: These are the same ingredients as back home, but it tastes so good.

meta.s: LIGHTNING MCQUEEN rolls along the periphery of the square, seems lost in thought.
Uncle Topolino beckons McQueen over.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: You look so down, so low.
Is like you have flat tires.

meta.s: MAMA TOPOLINO, a hefty Italian grandmother pipes up, a mile a minute then drives off, now a car on a mission.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: She said you look like you're starving.
That she's going to make you a big meal, and fatten you up.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: You don't need to make a fuss!

meta.s: Too late.
She's disappeared inside her kitchen.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: A wise car hears one word and understands two.

meta.s: McQueen takes this in, impressed.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: While Mama cooks, come and take a stroll with me.

meta.s: They amble forward, Uncle Topolino setting the pace.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I brought my friend Mater along on the trip.
And I told him he needed to act different, that we weren't in Radiator Springs.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: Then why would you ask him to be someone else?

meta.s: McQueen considers this - a realization.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I said some things during our fight...

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: You know, back when Guido and Luigi used to work for me, they would fight over everything.

meta.s: IN THE SQUARE - Guido dances with a girl.
Luigi suddenly CUTS IN.
They begin to ARGUE.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: They fight over what Ferrari was the best Ferrari; which one of them look more like a Ferrari...
There were even some non-Ferrari fights.

meta.s: Guido now LIFTS Luigi, cuts BACK in.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: So I tell them, va bene.
Everybody fights now and then, especially best friends.

meta.s: McQueen takes this in.
Seems to take some small comfort.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: But you gotta make up fast.

meta.s: McQueen's comfort quickly evaporates.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: No fight more important than friendship.

meta.s: Guido and Luigi now dance together with the girl and her friend who has just arrived.
All having a great time.
They dance past us, crossing in front of MCQUEEN AND UNCLE TOPOLINO.
We STAY WITH them.

dialogue.name: UNCLE TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: Chi trova un'amico, trova un tesoro.

dialogue.name: MAMA TOPOLINO
dialogue.s: (ARRIVING) Whoever find a friend, find a treasure.

meta.s: Mama Topolino drops a tray of food in front of McQueen.

ON MCQUEEN, distant, taking all of this in, lost in thought as, in the background, Uncle Topolino and Mama Topolino talk, then argue, then make up (all in Italian) all while we stay on McQueen's pensive face ---
Stephenson glides along, all business.

dialogue.name: STEPHENSON
dialogue.s: Finn, one hour to Porto Corsa.

meta.s: Finn watches as HOLLEY attaches a new EMERGENCY LIGHT on Mater's roof.
It looks exactly like his old one.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: That should just about do it.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: But you know, everything's voice- activated these days.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I thought you was supposed to be making me a disguise.

meta.s: ZWWWWAT!
A HOLOGRAPHIC disguise suddenly umbrellas out, emitted from Mater's roof.
It drops a clean cloaking image of the EASTERN EUROPEAN TOW TRUCK over Mater.
ZWATTTT!
Mater suddenly wears lederhosen and a German hat.
He's transformed into Dracula, complete with fangs.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: (ALA DRACULA) I vant to siphon your gas.
Now make me a taco truck!

meta.s: Finn suddenly pushes a button, stops the madness.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: The idea is to keep a low profile, Mater.

meta.s: Mater, chastened, moves on.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: So I just go in, pretend to be this truck.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: And leave the rest to us.

meta.s: Holley turns back to her work.
The disguise's cloaking is larger than Mater.
As a result, Holley must dial it back to fit his body.
As she carefully calibrates the hologram:

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: I have to do the final fitting on your disguise.

meta.s: Holley STOPS.
The 3D disguise is now flush with his frame, but dents SHOW THROUGH.
She deploys A BONDO SPRAYER on a robotic arm, moves it toward one of Mater's DENTS.
Mater pulls away.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: The disguise won't calibrate effectively without a smooth surface to graft onto.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: For a second there I thought you was trying to fix my dents.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I don't get them dents buffed, pulled, filled or painted by nobody.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: I come by each one of them with my best friend Lightning McQueen.

dialogue.name: MATER (CONT'D)
dialogue.s: I want to remember these dents forever.

dialogue.name: HOLLEY
dialogue.s: So you were being serious in Paris?
McQueen isn't just part of your cover?

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: Friendships can be dangerous in our line of work, Mater.

dialogue.name: MATER
dialogue.s: But my line of work is towing and salvage.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: And Miss Shiftwell's is designing iPhone apps.

meta.s: Finn hits a button.
The walls transform into a MASSIVE WEAPONS CACHE.

dialogue.name: FINN
dialogue.s: You look a little light on weapons.

meta.s: Off Mater's RXN ---
--- STEPHENSON EMERGES LOUDLY from a tunnel.
He powers forward, starts his descent into Italy ---

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: You are looking live at beautiful Porto Corsa, Italy, on the Italian Riviera.
What a magnificent setting for the second race of the World Grand Prix.

meta.s: Over sweeping helicopter BEAUTY SHOTS: 78.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Well Brent, they call this place "The Gem of the Riviera," and it's easy to see why.

meta.s: A local fishing boat chugs through an idyllic waterway, beneath bridges that connect hillside villas.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: With its secluded beaches and opulent casinos, Porto Corsa truly is a playground for the wealthy.

meta.s: A long line of RICH-LOOKING YACHTS in the harbor.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: And everyone who's anyone is here today.

meta.s: Rich SPORTS CARS drive past pricey shops.

dialogue.name: DAVID HOBBSCAP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: From the ultra-rich and super- famous, to world leaders and important dignitaries.

meta.s: THE POPEMOBILE, visible in a crowd, drives through town.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP (V.O.)
dialogue.s: You can't do a three-point turn around here without bumping into some celebrity!

meta.s: HELICOPTER SHOT of the Casino.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Welcome everyone to the second race of the World Grand Prix!

meta.s: MUSTANGBURGER, HOBBSCAP and CARTRIP in the control booth.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER
dialogue.s: The big news continues to be Allinol.
Sir Miles Axlerod spoke to the press earlier today to answer questions about its safety.

meta.s: FOOTAGE OF THE PRESS CONFERENCE - Miles Axlerod, at a podium, addresses the press throng.
He looks a bit exasperated.

dialogue.name: MILES AXLEROD
dialogue.s: An independent panel of scientists has determined that Allinol is completely safe.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER
dialogue.s: So the race will go on, folks.

meta.s: RACE GRAPHICS show Francesco with 10 points at the top of the race standings.

dialogue.name: DARRELL CARTRIP
dialogue.s: But the question everyone is asking: Will the real Lightning McQueen show up today?

meta.s: ON THE TRACK - As the racers begin to get into position on the grid.

dialogue.name: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Talk about a home- track advantage.
Francesco Bernoulli grew up racing on this course.

dialogue.name: ITALIAN TRACK ANNOUNCER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Signore e signori, in the pole position, numero uno...

meta.s: The crowd is cheering already, knows who this is.
The Italian crowd roars and chants for their hometown hero.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: (TO MCQUEEN) And your big mistake, McQueen!

meta.s: McQueen missed this comment.
He approaches his grid position, lost in thought.
Cheers (not so thunderous, obviously) from the crowd.
McQueen doesn't seem to notice.
IN MCQUEEN'S PIT - His team exchanges looks, worried.

dialogue.name: FILLMORE
dialogue.s: If you're worried about your fuel, man, don't.

meta.s: BACK ON THE STARTING GRID

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: No, guys, I just really wish Mater were here.

meta.s: Francesco parks next to him, grinning.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
dialogue.s: For famous race cars like Francesco and well... you, to be far away from home is not easy.

dialogue.name: MCQUEEN
dialogue.s: I think you forgot the insulting part of that insult.

dialogue.name: FRANCESCO
